awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide support to a group from the                        University of Michigan to continue a research program in high                   energy physics.  The group is participating in a experiment                     (UA6) at the Super Proton Synchrotron (CERN) during proton -                    antiproton collider operation.  The experiment uses an                          internal hydrogen gas target and studies high momentum                          transfer single particle production, focussing on photons,                      production of e+e-pairs, and low momentum transfer elastic                      scattering in both proton-proton and antiproton-proton                          interactions.  The ability to compare direct photons from                       proton-proton and proton-antiproton interactions with the same                  apparatus yields a measurement of the gluon momentum                            distribution in protons and the scale parameter lambda used in                  the theory of quantum chromodynamics.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
